title: Full-Time Full-Stack Developer – MVP Civic Tech Platform
type: Full-Time Contract (1 year, with potential to extend)
summary: We're hiring a full-time developer to build a new civic-tech platform from scratch. You'll work independently, shape product direction, and implement full-stack features using modern tools and open data principles.
whyItMatters: Nexus is building a civic-tech platform to make verified public data accessible in real time—helping users engage with accurate, trustworthy information when it matters most. We're laying the foundation for a suite of open-access dashboards spanning governance, housing, transit, health, and more—all built on a unified architecture designed for long-term public value.
responsibilities: Own full-stack development including architecture, backend APIs, frontend interfaces, authentication, mapping, and deployment. Collaborate with designers and provide feedback to help shape the product vision.
requirements: Strong proficiency in React and TypeScript
Experience building and consuming REST or GraphQL APIs
Ability to deploy and maintain scalable, secure backend services
bonuses: Experience with civic tech, geospatial data, or election-related tools
Familiarity with Nigeria’s electoral/polling unit landscape
Experience working with open data or digital transparency platforms
howToApply: Please submit your application via the form. You'll be asked to share a brief introduction, links to relevant past work (GitHub, portfolio, etc.), your availability, and expected monthly salary in NGN. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled. We aim to onboard by mid-August.
terms: All IP retained by Nexus Engineering & Planning Ltd.

title: Full-Time Technical Data Analyst
type: Full-Time Contract (1 year, with potential to extend)
summary: We’re hiring a full-time technical data analyst to support the development of data-driven dashboards and public insights. You’ll work across civic and spatial datasets, build clean pipelines, and collaborate with the project team to extract insights that inform visual storytelling and reporting.
whyItMatters: At Nexus, we use data to improve public understanding of infrastructure, governance, and planning. Your work will help transform raw datasets into clear insights that support transparency, civic engagement, and better decision-making.
responsibilities: Work with structured and spatial datasets to support dashboards and reporting. Develop repeatable data workflows and assist in QA. Collaborate with developers and the project manager to identify key insights for internal and external communications.
requirements: 2+ years of experience in data analysis or spatial analytics
Experience working with public or civic datasets
Strong attention to detail and documentation
bonuses: Familiarity with Nigerian public data or election datasets
Experience supporting blog posts or newsletters with insights
Experience with dashboard platforms or data visualization tools
howToApply: Apply via the form. Please include a brief introduction, links to past work (dashboards, repositories, or reports), your availability, and expected monthly rate. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.
terms: All IP retained by Nexus Engineering & Planning Ltd.
